ngiemboon: Mǒonsê gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, pi pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, pi zẅíʼte membʉ̌ lâ mentÿɔgɔ́ mie mèŋ ńne ńnáa mbwó pi, légwɔ́ gie pi ge giŋ páʼ é ne ńzɛ́te, à cʉa púʼu, pi tsẅɛ́, ḿbiŋ ńzyɛ́ʼ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé metá pi nǎa mbwó pi.
en: “Now, Israel, listen to the statutes and ordinances   I am teaching you to follow, so that you may live,  # 4:1 Lv 25:18; Dt 4:40; 5:16,33; 8:1; 11:9; 25:15; 30:16; 2Kg 18:32; Ezk 18:9; Am 5:14 enter, and take possession of the land the Lord, the God of your ancestors,  # 4:1 Ex 3:13,15–16; Dt 1:11,21; 6:3; 12:1; 27:3; Jos 18:3; 2Ch 13:12; 28:9; 29:5; Ezr 8:28; 10:11 is giving you.

ngiemboon: Pi te gẅiin lékẅiʼi tsɔ́ mmó na shwóŋè gie n zǎb ńtíi gẅí wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńké te gẅiin létsẅɛ́te tsɔ́ mmó mǒ wɔ́; pi ge giŋ páʼ mentÿɔgɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ne ńzɛ́te, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ n zǎb ńtíi gẅí.
en: You must not add anything to what I command you or take anything away from it,   so that you may keep the commands of the Lord your God I am giving you.

ngiemboon: Pi ka lɔg nÿɔ́g mí, ńgyá mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka gÿo ńtí nò ssé Mbâa gie ée tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Peyɔɔ; Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à ka gʉa nùɔ pʉ̀a pí, ḿbyág pʉ̀a metsèm pie é la cʉ́me nzèm ssé Mbâa gie ée tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Peyɔɔ.
en: Your eyes have seen what the Lord did at Baal-peor, for the Lord your God destroyed every one of you who followed Baal of Peor.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńgʉa na pi pie pi la lannɛ́ na Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, pi ée lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó metsèm.
en: But you who have remained faithful   to the Lord your God are all alive today.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńzsé ngie n da ná membʉ̌ lâ mentÿɔgɔ́ né pi, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé yɔ̀ɔn, e la tsẅii mbwó mèŋ, à cʉa púʼu, pi gwɔ́ tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie pi ge zyɛ́ʼ kú, ńgiŋ páʼ membʉ̌ lâ mentÿɔgɔ́ ŋwɛ́ ne ńzɛ́te.
en: Look, I have taught you statutes and ordinances as the Lord my God has commanded me, so that you may follow them in the land you are entering to possess.

ngiemboon: Pi ge kúʼte mɛ̌ membʉ̌ lâ mentÿɔgɔ́ ŋwɛ́, é giŋ páʼ é ne ńzɛ́te; é ge gwɔ́ páʼ gí zsénò pɔ́ sí legye, á mvfò pʉ̀a pie é ge júʼ páʼ mé kíme mɔɔn membʉ̌ ntsèm, pɔ́ ge láʼa gɔɔn ngie «wɔɔn aa máa ngwòŋ, ńgwɔ́ kwaʼ ngwòŋ pʉ̀a pie é gẅiin zsénò pɔ́ legye.»
en: Carefully follow them, for this will show your wisdom and understanding in the eyes of the peoples. When they hear about all these statutes, they will say, ‘This great nation is indeed a wise and understanding people.’

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ wɛ̌ máa ngwòŋ gẅiin messé mie ée lejʉ́ŋ yé fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm páʼ pege? Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé yege ée né pege fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm gie pege ne ńtóŋo yé.
en: For what great nation is there that has a god near to it as the Lord our God is to us whenever we call to him?

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ máa ngwòŋ gẅiin mentÿɔgɔ́ mie é tyé ndʉŋndʉŋ ḿbiŋ ńgiŋ páʼ á ne ńzɛ́te, tà é gwɔ́ páʼ sɔɔn lepʉ̌ sie n zába mvfò pi lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn lɔɔn?
en: And what great nation has righteous statutes and ordinances like this entire law I set before you today?

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndàʼ ngie pi laga twó gí, ḿbiŋ ḿbɔ́ɔn kwaʼ twó mbùm gí mboŋó, á na mí melyɛ̌ʼ njÿó ntsèm; ḿbɔ́gɔ páʼ ngwɔ́ pi lege shúm sie pi ka lɔg nÿɔ́g mí ńgyá, tà é le maga letʉ́m pi wɔ́; pi gÿo penkʉ́ pi lâ penkʉ́ penkʉ́ pí, é zsé sɛ̌ shúm.
en: “Only be on your guard and diligently watch yourselves,   so that you don’t forget  # 4:9 Dt 6:12; 8:11; Pr 3:1; 4:5 the things your eyes have seen and so that they don’t slip from your mind  # 4:9 Or don’t depart from your heart as long as you live. Teach them to your children and your grandchildren.  # 4:9–10 Ex 12:26; Dt 6:7,20–25; 11:2–7,18–21; 31:12–13,19–22; 32:46; Jos 4:6,21–22; 8:35; Ps 34:11; 78:5

ngiemboon: Pi kímte lyɛ̌ʼ gie pi la tyé lekwɛ́ Olɛb, á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: «Cúʼte láʼ lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ, n ge gÿo pɔ́ júʼu shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn, éfó mǒ, é zíʼi lépɔ́gɔ wɔ́ɔn, á na melyɛ̌ʼ láʼ ntsèm mie pɔ́ ge néŋe ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, é piŋ zíʼi membʉ̌ mɔ́ɔn mbwó gubé yɔ́b.»
en: The day you stood before the Lord your God   at Horeb, the Lord said to me, ‘Assemble the people before me, and I will let them hear my words, so that they may learn to fear me  # 4:10 Dt 5:29; Is 57:11; Jr 5:22; 32:39; Zph 3:7; Mal 3:5 all the days they live on the earth and may instruct their children.’

ngiemboon: Pi la tó lyɛʼó ŋwɛ́, ńtyé tsìŋe lekwɛ́; emmɔ̌g pú ńgwoon lekwɛ́ ŋwɛ́, éfó ndumó, ńkwɔ́ʼ tà lʉ́m kíbe lefaŋ. Ńkwɔ́ʼɔ púʼu tsɛ̀ɛ séssé ndyé pɔ́ melɔ́ɔn mie é síŋe lê tsẅîŋ.
en: You came near and stood at the base of the mountain,   a mountain blazing with fire  # 4:11 Ex 3:2; 19:18; Dt 5:23; 9:15; Heb 12:18 into the heavens and enveloped in a totally black cloud.  # 4:11 Gn 15:12; Ex 20:21; Dt 5:22; 2Sm 22:10; 1Kg 8:12; 2Ch 6:1; Ps 18:9; 97:2; Is 60:2; Jr 13:16; Ezk 34:12; Jl 2:2; Zph 1:15

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la fó tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g, ńgɔɔn nò né pi. Pi la júʼ páʼ à gɔɔn nò, tá ńké te yé gyá, mé lɔ́ɔn ńjúʼu pɔ́ ngyè ye.
en: Then the Lord spoke to you from the fire.   You kept hearing the sound of the words, but didn’t see a form; there was only a voice.  # 4:9–12 Ex 19:10–19; Dt 5:8; Heb 12:18–19

ngiemboon: À la gÿo pi zsé kʉ̀a yé, á kʉ̀a gie à lɔ̌ɔn ńdɔgɔ ńtsẅii páʼ pi ge giŋ púʼu, é gwɔ́ membʉ̌ legém mie à la ŋweʼe na melàŋa tóon mémbʉ́a.
en: He declared his covenant   to you. He commanded you to follow the Ten Commandments,  # 4:13 Ex 34:28; Dt 10:4 which he wrote on two stone tablets.  # 4:13 Ex 34:1,4; Dt 5:22; 10:1,3

ngiemboon: Afʉʼó ŋwɛ́, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsẅi né mèŋ ngie n zíʼi gẅí membʉ̌ lâ mentÿɔgɔ́, tá à cʉa púʼu, pi gwɔ́ tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie pi ge zyɛ́ʼ kú, ńgiŋ páʼ membʉ̌ lâ mentÿɔgɔ́ ŋwɛ́ ne ńzɛ́te.
en: At that time the Lord commanded me to teach you statutes and ordinances for you to follow in the land you are about to cross into and possess.

ngiemboon: Páʼ pi la ké te gyá tsɔ́ liŋé gie ngwɔ́ mé gɔɔn ngie aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á lyɛ̌ʼ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lɔ̌ɔn fóo tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g, á lekwɛ́ Olɛb ńgɔɔn nò né pi wɔ́ la, pi laga twó gí mboŋó;
en: “Diligently watch yourselves #— #because you did not see any form on the day the Lord spoke to you out of the fire at Horeb #— #

ngiemboon: ḿbɔ́gɔ páʼ ngwɔ́ pi fʉa kwò gí, tà ńgÿo tútú gẅie ngwɔ́, á gẅiin mbɔɔ yɛ̌ ntí liŋé wɔ́ɔ, lésẅé mámbàŋa kà manzwě wɔ́ɔ,
en: so you don’t act corruptly and make an idol for yourselves in the shape of any figure: a male or female form,

ngiemboon: lésẅé mbɔɔ yɛ̌ ntí nɔ̀ɔn wɔ́ɔ gie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, tà mbɔɔ lésẅé wɛ̌ méshʉ́ŋ wɔ́ɔ,
en: or the form of any animal on the earth, any winged creature that flies in the sky,

ngiemboon: tà mbɔɔ lésẅé gígyé menɔ̀ɔn pie é kʉʼʉ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, tà mbɔɔ lésẅé messó mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ mentse;
en: any creature that crawls on the ground, or any fish in the waters under the earth.

ngiemboon: ḿbɔ́gɔ páʼ ńgwɔ́ pi gwɔ́ tà ḿbʉʼʉ twó gí, ńgyá nèm, ńgyá saŋ lâ mecÿɔ́ʼsaŋ, tà mbɔɔ shúm ntsèm sie ée lefaŋ; ńdeen ńgwáʼa lÿɔ̀g, ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò pɔ́b, ńguʼte wɔ́b: eshúm ŋwɛ́, ée sie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à la pú ńná né meláʼ ntsèm mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ.
en: When you look to the heavens and see the sun, moon, and stars #— #all the stars in the sky #— #do not be led astray to bow in worship to them and serve them.   The Lord your God has provided them for all people everywhere under heaven.  # 4:19 Ps 19:1

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńgʉa na pi, mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la kaa gẅí, ńdɔgɔ gẅí éfó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅɛ; é gwɔ́ kwàʼ ngwòŋ ngɔ́ʼ; ńdɔgɔ gẅí éfóo wó ńkẅɛɛ púʼu, légwɔ́ gie pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pé, ńgwɔ́ kwàʼ pʉ̀a pé, yɔɔn áa mmó gie á gÿo pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pé tà ńkú lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.
en: But the Lord selected you and brought you out of Egypt’s iron furnace   to be a people for his inheritance, as you are today.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gyáŋa lóŋ né mèŋ, ńtíi gẅí, à la kʉa ngie n te láʼ zyɛ́ʼ ntse Juundʉŋ wɔ́; é piŋ ké le láʼ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ mbòŋo gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à la ná né pi páʼ tÿɔgɔ́ wɔ́.
en: “The Lord was angry with me on your account.   He swore that I would not cross the Jordan and enter the good land  # 4:21 Dt 8:7 the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.  # 4:21 Dt 15:4

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, n ge kwé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ wɔɔn ngwòŋ. N te túm ntse Juundʉŋ wɔ́; táʼ, ńgʉa na pi, mbà pi ge túm, é zyɛ́ʼ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ wɛ̂ ngwòŋ mbòŋo gẅie ée na yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ.
en: I won’t be crossing the Jordan because I am going to die in this land.   But you are about to cross over and take possession of this good land.

ngiemboon: Pi laga twó gí, ḿbɔ́gɔ lélege kʉ̀a gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à la gÿo pi lâ pɔ̌ gwa, ḿbɔ́gɔ páʼ ngwɔ́ pi nyɛte metútú, tà é gwɔ́ mie ngwɔ́ é gẅiin yɛ̌ ntí liŋé wɔ́ɔ, ńguʼte ńdɔg fʉa mánzsè gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi ka tÿɔ́gɔ gẅí mǒ.
en: Be careful not to forget the covenant of the Lord your God that he made with you, and make an idol for yourselves in the shape of anything he has forbidden you.

ngiemboon: Ńtí nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ée mmɔ̌g gẅie é sẅága jʉʼ, ńgwɔ́ Ssé gie e kwɔ́ʼɔ lóŋ.
en: For the Lord your God is a consuming fire,   a jealous God.  # 4:23–24 Ex 20:5; 34:14; Dt 5:9; 6:15; Jos 24:19; Heb 12:29

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńdáʼ ńgwɔ́ tà ńgẅiin penkʉ́ lâ penkʉ́ penkʉ́, ńgwɔ́ tà ńzye ńtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ wɛ̌ ngwòŋ, ńdʉʼʉ léjúʼ ncwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńnyɛte metútú, tà é gwɔ́ mie ngwɔ́ é gẅiin yɛ̌ ntí liŋé wɔ́ɔ, ḿbiŋ ńguʼte; ńgÿo mmó gie á té Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi poŋ, ńdɔg ńgÿo lóŋ we ffó,
en: “When you have children and grandchildren and have been in the land a long time, and if you act corruptly, make an idol in the form of anything, and do what is evil in the sight of the Lord your God, angering him,

ngiemboon: mbà pi ge gwóon lége tsɛ̀ɛ wɔɔn ngwòŋ gẅie pi ge túm ntse Juundʉŋ, é zyɛ́ʼ kú lɛ̂; mbà melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mí té gíŋ ńgyɔ́ɔn wɔ́, mbà pi ge pú lége. N dɔ̌g lefaŋ pɔ́ tsetsáʼ ńgÿo pajÿòngyá lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn na mɔɔn menò mie e shwoŋó gẅí lɔɔn.
en: I call heaven and earth as witnesses against you today that you will quickly perish   from the land you are about to cross the Jordan to possess. You will not live long there, but you will certainly be destroyed.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge láʼ gÿo pi syeente nùɔ meláʼ, tà cʉ́ʼ vʉʼʉ pɔ́ mbɔ́ntáʼ pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ mie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge lɔgɔ gẅí gʉa né wó.
en: The Lord will scatter you among the peoples,   and you will be reduced to a few survivors  # 4:27 Lit be left few in number among the nations where the Lord your God will drive you.

ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mɛ̌ mengwòŋ, ńguʼte messé mie pʉ̀a mesoŋ la líe tÿǒ lâ tóon, ńdɔg mbwó mɔ́b ńnyɛte, é gwɔ́ messé mie é té jʉʼ gyá, ńké te jʉʼ júʼ, ńké te mmó pfɛ́, ḿbiŋ ńké te gyě mmó júʼ.
en: There you will worship man-made gods of wood and stone, which cannot see, hear, eat, or smell.

ngiemboon: Pi ge láʼ gwɔ́ wó púʼu, é gíŋe faʼa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi; pi lɔɔn faʼa yé lé ntʉ́m gẅí ntsèm pɔ́ léme gí ntsèm, mbà pi ge gyá yé.
en: But from there, you will search for the Lord your God, and you will find him when you seek him with all your heart and all your soul.

ngiemboon: Á ge láʼ tyé tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ, pi pú ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ cʉanò, á fʉ̀ʼ gie mɔɔn menò mie n gɔɔn lɔɔn, é tǒ tà ńkúu gẅí, pi leen ńké ńgíŋe ḿbiŋe nzèm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńjúʼ ncwò wé.
en: When you are in distress and all these things have happened to you, in the future you will return to the Lord your God and obey him.

ngiemboon: Ńtí nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ee Ssé gie e gẅiin tsɔ́ɔnmezìŋe; ngwɔ́ á le gẅí gwáʼ, ngwɔ́ á le gÿo pi lége wɔ́; à těen ńdáʼa lyɛ̌ʼ ńdege kʉ̀a gie à la gÿo pâ metá pi gwa wɔ́.
en: He will not leave you, destroy you, or forget the covenant   with your ancestors that he swore to them by oath, because the Lord your God is a compassionate God.  # 4:31 Ex 34:6

ngiemboon: Shúshu, pi kag tʉ̀ lézsé menò fʉ̀ʼʉmvfò, é menò na melyɛ̌ʼ mie é la vɔg ńgwɔ́ wó tá mé zyé gẅí, léfó lyɛ̌ʼ gie e Ssé la pwóon nyìŋ mesoŋ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, léfó jʉʼ gie tsetsáʼ zyete wó ńgʉa ńcʉ́me jʉʼ gie á zsote wó. Ńjúʼ kà tsɔ̌ máamáa nò páʼ wɔɔn lǎ zɔɔn ńcʉate wɔ́ɔ? Kà mé lǎ zɔɔn ńjúʼu tsɔ́ nò páʼ yɛ̌ wɔ́ɔ?
en: “Indeed, ask about the earlier days that preceded you, from the day God created mankind   on the earth and from one end of the heavens to the other: Has anything like this great event ever happened, or has anything like it been heard of?

ngiemboon: Kà tsɔ́ láʼ lǎ zɔɔn ńjúʼ ngyè Ssé gie e fóo tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g ńgɔɔn nò páʼ pi la júʼ lɛ̂, tà ńké ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ntʉ̀ntʉ̀ wɔ́ɔ?
en: Has a people heard God’s voice speaking from the fire as you have, and lived?

ngiemboon: Kà tsɔ́ ssé lǎ zɔɔn faʼa légʉa tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ ngwòŋ, ńgÿo epʉ̀a tsɔ́ ngwòŋ wendyɛ̀ʼɛ fó wó ńkẅɛ wɔ́ɔ? Ngǎŋ! Táʼ, yɔɔn ké ńgwɔ́ mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à la gÿo na pi, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egíbtò, tà pi gyá; à la cʉ́ʼʉ lélɔgɔ gẅí fó wó ńkẅɛ, ńtém ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ ntí ntí twó pʉ̀a Egíbtò, à la gÿo menkʉ̀ʼʉ menò lâ menò mɔɔnmɔɔn. Ńdɔg ngʉ̀ʼ ye ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ na gí twó; ńgÿo mendàagyá menò mie ngwɔ́ mé júʼ ḿbɔ́g.
en: Or has a god attempted to go and take a nation as his own out of another nation, by trials, signs, wonders, and war, by a strong hand and an outstretched arm, by great terrors, as the Lord your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?

ngiemboon: Pi la pú ńgyá sɔɔn shúm lélɔg fó mǒ ńzsé ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔɔ Ssé, etsɔ̌ ssé yendyɛ̀ʼɛ te gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: You were shown these things so that you would know that the Lord is God; there is no other besides him.

ngiemboon: À la fó tÿǒ lepwó, ńgÿo pi júʼ ngyè ye, á lɔg ńzíʼi gẅí léjúʼ ncwò wé; ńgʉa ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, ńgÿo pi gyá máamáa mmɔ̌g, pi piŋ ńjúʼ páʼ à fóo tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g, ńgɔɔn nò né pi.
en: He let you hear his voice from heaven to instruct you.   He showed you his great fire on earth, and you heard his words from the fire.  # 4:36 Ex 19:18

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la kwoŋ metá pi. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo á tsɔ́ʼɔ gẅí gẅie pi lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngẅɛ̀ yɔ́b, yé zɔ la piŋ ńdɔgɔ máa ngʉ̀ʼ we, éfó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅile gẅí;
en: Because he loved   your ancestors, he chose their descendants after them and brought you out of Egypt by his presence and great power,

ngiemboon: À la luŋ mvfò, ńtág meláʼ mie é gyɔ́ɔn, ḿbiŋ ńtʉ ńcʉa gẅí, tá ńdɔg ńgÿo pi zyɛ́ʼ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ wɔ́b gẅie à nǎ né pi, é cʉ́ʼ gẅí tÿɔgɔ́. Yɔɔn áa mmó gie á la gÿo, é ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tÿɔgɔ́ gẅí tà ńkú lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.
en: to drive out before you nations greater and stronger than you and to bring you in and give you their land as an inheritance,   as is now taking place.

ngiemboon: Pi ge fó lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, é zsé, é piŋ ne sáŋa ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔɔ Ssé, á tÿǒ lepwó, tà mbɔɔ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ; etsɔ̌ ssé yendyɛ̀ʼɛ te gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: Today, recognize and keep in mind that the Lord is God in heaven above and on earth below; there is no other.

ngiemboon: Pi giŋ páʼ membʉ̌ lâ mentÿɔgɔ́ mé mie mèŋ n nǎ né pi lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn ne ńzɛ́te, tá à cʉa púʼu, pi lâ gubé gí, e júʼ mboŋó; ḿbiŋ ńzye ńtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à nǎ né pi pɔ́ ndàʼndàʼ.
en: Keep his statutes and commands, which I am giving you today, so that you and your children after you may prosper and so that you may live long in the land the Lord your God is giving you for all time.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê leen ńké ńgʉa na metÿǒsoŋ mie ée na yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Juundʉŋ á shÿó sǎʼnèm, ńtyɛ́te metÿǒsoŋ méntá, ńtsɔ́ʼ;
en: Then Moses set apart three cities across the Jordan to the east.

ngiemboon: légwɔ́ gie e gwɔ́ metÿǒsoŋ lelyěen, á mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à lɔgɔ́ fʉa pwó ńzẅé fɛ̌ we, mbà à zɔ̌ɔn laa yé pʉ̀a. À cʉa púʼu, à kÿo ńgʉa ńdyeen tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ̌ tàʼ na mɔɔn metÿǒsoŋ tá ńdɔg ńtsẅɛ́.
en: Someone could flee there who committed manslaughter, killing his neighbor accidentally without previously hating him. He could flee to one of these cities and stay alive:

ngiemboon: Atÿǒsoŋo lelyěen ye pʉ̀a na ngẅɛ̀te Lẅímbèŋ gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo Mbetsɛ̂ɛ gie áa nkùɔmekwaʼá, á sàŋa; aye ngẅɛ̀te Ngâd, á gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo Lamɔd gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ pàga láʼa pʉ̀a Ngalad; ńgÿo ye ngẅɛ̀te pʉ̀a Manase, á gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo Ngolaŋ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ pàga láʼa Mbashÿaŋ.
en: Bezer in the wilderness on the plateau land, belonging to the Reubenites; Ramoth in Gilead, belonging to the Gadites; or Golan in Bashan, belonging to the Manassites.

ngiemboon: Sɔɔn lɔgɔ páʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lepʉ̌ sie Mǒonsê la cʉ́me mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ.
en: This is the law Moses gave the Israelites.

ngiemboon: É mentÿɔgɔ́, á legìŋ páʼ á ne ńzɛ́te, ńgÿo mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi la záb, É membʉ̌, lâ mentÿɔgɔ́ mie à la náa mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ la fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅɛ.
en: These are the decrees, statutes, and ordinances Moses proclaimed to them after they came out of Egypt,

ngiemboon: Menò mɔɔn lɔ́ɔn ńcʉate páʼɔɔn na yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Juundʉŋ, á tsɛ̀ɛ fúʼu lélíe Mbɛ́d-Peyɔɔ, á tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa fùɔ Sihoŋ gẅie à laa fùɔ pʉ̀a Amɔɔ, ńtsẅé Eshÿemboŋ, mbà Mǒonsê pâ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ la lÿɔ́ʼɔ yé tà ńjÿó, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ la fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅɛ.
en: across the Jordan in the valley facing Beth-peor in the land of King Sihon of the Amorites. He lived in Heshbon, and Moses and the Israelites defeated him after they came out of Egypt.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la zyɛ́ʼ ńkúu láʼ ye, ńjÿó láʼ yé, tà ńgíŋe ńjÿó láʼa fùɔ Ɔg gẅie à laa fùɔ pʉ̀a Mbashÿaŋ. Pɔɔn mefùɔ pʉ̀a Amɔɔ lɔ́ɔn ńtsẅé na yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Juundʉŋ, á shÿó sǎʼnèm;
en: They took possession of his land and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two Amorite kings who were across the Jordan to the east,

ngiemboon: léfó Aloyɛ gẅie aa nkwɔʼɔ́ ntse, é ntse Alenoŋ, ńgʉa gʉa ńkúu lekwɛ́ Sihoŋ (á Sihoŋ gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋ lê Ɛlemoŋ),
en: from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Valley as far as Mount Sion (that is, Hermon)

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn pàga láʼ áa páʼɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ḿbú ńgwɔ́ kwòŋo témmó gie áa shÿó sǎʼnèm, á na yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Juundʉŋ, ńgʉa gʉa ńkúu ntse pfó máŋʉ́, á tsìŋe lekwɛ́ Pisenga.
en: and all the Arabah on the east side of the Jordan as far as the Dead Sea below the slopes of Pisgah.
